description: A big couple of days for pharmaceutical buy-outs, and Lithuania joins the EU.
teaser: A big couple of days for pharmaceutical buy-outs, and Lithuania joins the EU.
contentencoded: First up on today's show, we'll talk about the numerous pharmaceutical buy-outs that have gone down in the last two days. Plus, why buy a ticket for the Titanic after it has struck an iceberg? It’s a question that some analysts are asking Lithuania after the tiny Baltic state became — at the beginning of this month — the 19th member of the European Union to join monetary union and adopt the euro.

itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, January 13, 2015
title: PODCAST: Lithuania adopts the euro
